description.narrative: Sanitation and Hygiene: By 2022, vulnerable communities in targeted areas end open defecation and households have capacity to maintain adequate sanitation facilities and hygiene practices with support from government and local service providers

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sanitation and Hygiene: By 2022, vulnerable communities in targeted areas end open defecation and households have capacity to maintain adequate sanitation facilities and hygiene practices with support from government and local service providers

description.narrative: Progress was made on ending open defecation in Shan and Magwe despite COVID-19 restrictions on movement and protocol to maintain social distancing. About 654 villages in Shan were triggered and 261 villages are externally verified and declared ODF villages in January 2020. About 93,387 people are now living in Open Defecation Free Communities with ODF achievement rate of 40% in Shan. In Magwe, the remaining 219 villages out of 746 villages from 3 townships (Ngape, Salin and Pwint Phyu) were triggered and the triggering process committed for Magwe Region was completed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/08/2020

Percentage of triggered communities that achieve open-defecation-free (ODF) status (NEW SP output)
